column4: Question: I'm installing lucid lynx alternate cd on an old computer w/ a new HDD. It doesn't recognize my HDD and offers some drivers to use. However none of the drivers seem to follow a make/model pattern...so how do I know which driver to pick for my seagate barracuda hdd?
The hard drive is not recognized?  What kind of hard drive is it?  That's unusual

it's a brand new seagate barracuda 500 gb 7200. It is not recognized because the firmware can't recognize HDDs that big (my guess), so I'd like to make a small aprtition. But I need to pick a driver first to do that
If the BIOS can't deal with a hard drive that big then no drivers are going to help you.

One possibility is that it's not the absolute size, but number of cylinders.  Since it's all logical these days maybe you can calculate a different geometry with fewer cylinders that comes out to the same size.
well I'd like to try, I just need to know how to interpret  the esoteric driver names in terms of easily understood HDD names like western digital or seagate
What, what make and model is the hard drive?
seagate, barracuda, ST3500641AS-RK. 7200 rpm
I ask because I've read that certain external Seagate drives don't implement the real SCSI/ATAPI/etc interface, and actually do need drivers, so they don't work under Linux.
that would suck. i cringe at the thought of having to pay special attention to what hardware I can buy. It's happened before with printers...
This is internal, right?
Do you have another computer you can hook it up to as a test?
no. I have a laptop but no enclosure
and I got it at a best buy, so if I take it in and say "it doesnt work with linux" everyone's heads are gonna explode
Google says that drive has no jumpers.  As I would expect from a SATA drive.  There is no master/slave
then i've been looking at HDDs for too long :(
Actually, is it possible the new drive is 6GB/s and your motherboard can't support that
im looking at the manual now and indeed there is a jumper to limit it to 1.5 gb/s, just dont know if it's set by default. continuing to read before i take it apart again
psusi, KI7MT: thank you for the help, I think I've discovered my problem and I'll try the fix now
So what was the problem?
I thought it needed to be speed limited, but dlentz said it can take sata 2 just fine
